Salutes his father and cooperates when father kneels down to help him with the coat
Struggles to put on fire gear correctly and needs correction from his older brother and father.
Shows willingness to learn by listening to his father and brother's instructions.
Eagerly accepts invitation to join the fire engine ride, showing enthusiasm and trust in his family.
Shares a playful moment with his older brother by sticking their tongues out at each other, indicating friendly sibling rapport.
Eagerly agrees to go along on the fire call and confidently operates the siren button on the fire engine.
Nods vigorously, seriously taking his father's command to stay near the truck and keep an eye out.
Smiles to the pumper operator (Engineer) in a friendly, sincere manner.
Watches his father perform a dangerous rescue with admiration and wonderment.
Stands full of love and pride while watching the fire, showing emotional openness and affection.
Calls out hesitantly to his father, showing trust and a desire for connection.

Notices the subtle flame on the roofline before others do.
Attempts to warn others about the danger but only manages a small, hesitant voice.
Transfixed and astonished by the flame, momentarily passive in a dangerous situation.

Stares down at the graves of Dennis and Mary Elizabeth McCaffrey.
Combs his hair in a gas station restroom, knots a tie, showing preparation and perseverance.
Faces the Fire Academy Chief after walking out six years prior, calmly responds to challenge.
Combs his hair, knots a tie, straightens his tie, steadies his gaze before entering the Fire Academy Chief's office.

Climbs out on an exposed I-beam over fire, balances across, and jumps down to a catwalk to reach his injured brother.
Calls out to approaching hoseline team to get their attention promptly.
Ignores Stephen's advice to wait for another hose team and attempts to reach the hoseline alone.
Slides down ladder to the floor despite dangerous conditions, showing decisiveness but possible recklessness.
Becomes paralyzed momentarily by fire's intimidation, showing hesitation and fear.
Regains composure and resolves 'No more,' then lifts a small wall extinguisher and approaches the fire despite discouraging odds.
Fights the fire aggressively and protects his brother at great personal risk.
Reassures his brother and respects his wishes in the ambulance.
Pleading emotionally for his brother not to die, showing deep concern and vulnerability.
Walking in the solemn funeral procession with fellow firemen, honoring the deceased.
Expresses emotional distress and desperation while paramedics work on his brother.
Maintains eye contact with his dying brother, showing emotional presence and connection.
Stands at attention beside Helen, holds Sean's hand with eyes clouded with tears during the funeral.
Hugs Helen and Sean at the cemetery after the funeral, then lets them go.
Pauses and leans beside Rimgale, quietly shares grief and unspoken pain about his brother's death.
Responds with a terse, possibly cynical remark 'Like it never happened...' to Rimgale's question about his brother's death.
Stands at attention beside Helen, holds Sean's hand, shows emotional restraint despite grief.
Responds briefly but meaningfully to Rimgale's questions, showing thoughtfulness and internal strength.
Walks quickly with Rimgale and bursts into Alderman Swayzak's office, indicating decisiveness and willingness to act.
Confronts Swayzak firmly with a sharp warning about his career.
Pauses at the door and looks back at Rimgale, who smiles slightly.
Hesitates when called by Rimgale, then nods and walks away.
Engages Jennifer briefly and with some concern about her quitting.
Leans over the desk close to Swayzak and delivers a confident, cutting threat about his career, then exits with assuredness.
Hesitates briefly when called by Rimgale but then nods and walks away, showing trust and respect to the more experienced investigator.
Engages in casual conversation with Jennifer showing social awareness but not taking any action beyond simple pleasantries.
Helps a new fireman buckle his coat correctly without hesitation.
